ai.summary: A challenging 17.1 km hike along the Cove Brook Greenway near Farnborough, UK. The route blends riverbank trails with woodland paths and brief urban sections, delivering steady effort and pockets of scenic water views.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-maintained towpaths and dirt trails along the Cove Brook, with grassy sections and occasional boardwalks over wetlands. Expect occasional mud after rain and some exposed, open stretches; portions may be shared with cyclists and pedestrians on urban sections.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, strenuous route. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers for variable UK weather. Stay on marked paths, watch for slippery edges near the water, and be mindful of cyclists on shared sections. Carry a map or offline GPS and keep a charged phone with emergency contacts. Bring enough water and snacks, take breaks as needed, and inform someone of your planned finish time.
recommended_gear: Water and snacks (3+ liters for longer or hot days)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October) for milder weather and longer daylight; winter hikes are possible with extra layers and caution.

seo.title: Cove Brook Greenway – 17.1 km Hard Hike near Farnborough, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the challenging Cove Brook Greenway hike near Farnborough, UK. A 17.1 km route combining riverbank towpaths, woodland trails, and urban stretches; includes safety tips and gear.
